solution_line_template: After the increase, he can lift {initial_lift_capacity}+{increase_without_straps}=<<{initial_lift_capacity}+{increase_without_straps}={lift_after_initial_increase}>>{lift_after_initial_increase} pounds

Decreasing the distance increase the amount he can lift by {lift_after_initial_increase}*{distance_increase_percent}=<<{lift_after_initial_increase}*{distance_increase_percent}={lift_increase_from_distance}>>{lift_increase_from_distance} pounds
So he can lift {lift_after_initial_increase}+{lift_increase_from_distance}=<<{lift_after_initial_increase}+{lift_increase_from_distance}={lift_for_10_meters}>>{lift_for_10_meters} for 10 feet
So his total weight is {lift_for_10_meters}+{lift_increase_from_straps}=<<{lift_for_10_meters}+{lift_increase_from_straps}={total_lift_capacity}>>{total_lift_capacity} pounds per hand
